response:
Immediate MRI is needed to confirm the thoracic cord lesion and distinguish compressive from inflammatory causes; baseline blood tests and cultures assess for infection and surgical fitness; serology and CSF studies are reserved until mass lesions are excluded or when demyelinating/inflammatory myelitis is suspected.

investigations = ["MRI of the whole spine with gadolinium contrast", "MRI of the brain", "Full blood count", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "Blood glucose", "Coagulation screen", "Blood cultures (aerobic and anaerobic) taken before antibiotics", "Serum vitamin B12 level", "Syphilis serology (e.g., TPHA/VDRL)", "Autoimmune screen (antinuclear antibody, extractable nuclear antigen panel, double-stranded DNA antibody)", "Aquaporin-4 and MOG antibody testing", "Lumbar puncture with CSF analysis including cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands, culture and viral PCR (after imaging excludes mass effect)", "Plain radiographs or CT of the spine and sacroiliac joints", "Electrocardiogram"]
